dataList.name: 黑檀女王的苹果
dataList.clue:
覆盖在这片区域的荆棘肆意蔓延，与构成其下肢的藤蔓相交错。
也许破坏它的下肢可以在某种程度上抑制它的疯长？

storyList.story:
记录遭遇该实体时收集到的信息。
<公司守则>第11章第2段：应该将其归类为异想体。
当它第一次与罪人们相遇时，异想体并未表现出敌意。正相反，它与罪人们进行了精神交流。
在我熟知的所有语言中，这个异想体采用了我最常用的一种语言与我们交流。我并没有看到任何像嘴或是声带一样的发声器官在运作。
"把白雪公主带来，" 异想体说到。一份前L公司的报告。在脱离与它的接触后，我分析发现它和F-04-22有一定联系。
除此之外，我发现了先前来进行初步调查的员工尸体。而ID卡则证实了他们来自行动计划组。在这之后，我们将现场残骸带走并在冲突爆发之前离开了那里。
报告结束。

记录与实体战斗时获得的信息。
<公司守则>第11章第3段注明：应该将该异想体风险等级设定为WAW.这是基于从分部设施中带回的管理程序中设定的。
我会描述它在战斗中的行为。
它通过增殖藤蔓攻击.它也会用藤蔓将自己周身包裹住，所形成的形状就像长裙一样；有可能它相信自己是一位"贵族"。
它的藤蔓有多种用途，比如说连续不断的刺伤一位罪人或是破土而出，从而击伤多位罪人。
另外，它坚固的外壳让它难以受到伤害。
在一场损失了多位罪人的战斗中，我们试图将它的一个手臂给移开（这是我所能做出的最恰当的描述）我发现它再也无法同时攻击所有罪人了。
我会记录我在今后的遭遇中发现的所有信息。
报告结束。

记录一条十分重要的发现。
我们能够在遭遇战中破坏它的头部。
起初，我们并未将它的头部当作攻击目标，因为头部实在过高，罪人们都无法触及，但希斯克里夫的莽撞为我们提供了一条有用的信息。
我们才得以成功破坏它的头部。虽然希斯克里夫的头部也被打爆了，但既然他可以反复复活，那么这也不过是一个微小的损失罢了。
尽管失去了头部，它也仍在不断攻击行动，但我们发现它的外壳变得十分的柔软。
破坏它的"肢体" 也变成了一个更为可行的任务。
虽然它的头部会在一段时间后再生，破坏它的四肢也避免了我们在接下来的战斗中受到它的强力攻击。
报告结束。

我被命令要尽可能详细地去描述这个“事物”。
于是我仔细观察了一下。
一个巨大的石板被放置再来一个看起来是用肌肉纤维编制而成的木头底座上。
当我靠近它时，它的用砖头制成的隔间开始颤抖起来。
出于好奇心，我想要更一步靠近去来看的更仔细……
但可惜的是，我的其他同事强烈建议我不要这么做。所以我便回头。
有一件事情我可以肯定，那就是根据雕刻在这个实体上的字母来判断，这应该是一个用来预测日期的东西。
我要说的就是这些。
→从那些字母貌似来源于一个古老的语言。如果李箱的描述是正确的话，那么那个石板基本可以判定为一个日历。

我曾有机会与该实体交战。
虽然对于观察者来说，看到自己的观察对象受到伤害是一件令人不悦的事情，但是与它战斗也为观察提供了更多信息。
它召唤了一定数量的血肉人偶，这些人偶都头戴石头面具，而我认为这个面具的材料和组成石板的材料是同一个。
提供将人偶献给石板的方式，我得以观察到它形状的变化。
那些颤抖的砖块都变宽了....或者说大概是这样。
我并不能准确表述这些变化有多大。但是变化的趋势是它变得越来越令人感到不详。
但我必须要说一句。
→你他妈为什么要把我放进去而不是那些戴面具的人偶？！你个傻逼钟表头，我要把你#%^&@[录音带后面的部分基本都被和谐了。]
→ 但丁做了正确的选择，从我的观察结果来看，这些血肉人偶，或者叫"泥偶，"在活着的时候不能被献祭。唯一的选择就是献出一个罪人。
→ 所以为什么是我@(##$[录音带后面的部分基本被和谐了。]

作为曾经被献给那个异想体的一员，
我即将描述一个令人不安，潮湿又怪异的经历。
我坚定不移地走向那个异想体，因为这个选择很明智。我没理由害怕，毕竟即使我烟消云散了，我也可以被复活。
准确来说，我并没有感受到死去。我在战斗中死过很多次，但是这一次我没有感受到痛苦或者是令人感到眩晕的闪光。我只是感觉到我被传送到了另一个地方。
可能我在宇宙里或者另一个维度。
我感官感受不到我身体和声音的存在。也许我的视力已经被剥夺，我也已然成为那个地方的一部分。
在那里，我可能看到了万物的终焉，你可以说是终末之日。
好吧我在描述的时候可能有点误导性了，我在那里，但我不存在于那里，但是我见证了世间万物全被撕成碎片的一刻
[录音带后面的部分基本都被和谐了。]
→我让李箱和善后小组的队员聊过一会天，他的心智似乎被腐蚀得相当严重了。但丁，我觉得从今往后我们最好让罪人避免直接参与到这些事件中。

记录与遭遇实体时收集到的信息。
<公司守则>第11章第2段：应当将其归类为异想体。
<公司守则> 第11章第2段附录3：应当将其归类为终末日历的附属异想体。
它带着一个形似潜水员头盔而外观简陋的面具。面具是由一种硬度较高的石头制作而成，其外部经过打磨抛光。
修正：与其说是经过抛光打磨，不如说它就是这么"制作出来的"。我没检测到任何人为加工的痕迹。
它的身体就像是单纯的肌肉纤维。皮肤以及其他保护层的缺失让它变得十分脆弱，但是实体数量较多时反而更难以应对。
报告结束。
下次我会报告与其直接对峙时发现的信息。

我在战斗中遇到了实体。
<公司守则>第11章第3段：应当将它的风险等级设定为TETH。
我会描述它在战斗中的行为。
实体会使用它们那瘦小但富有弹性的身体进行快速攻击。
它们经常会冲到罪人面前，并死死的抓住它们的攻击目标。它们难以被挣脱，有的实体甚至会因为它们的固执而死亡。
正如在先前的报告中提到的，实体似乎和终末日历有着很密切的联系。当实体被杀死或是“献给”终末日历时，你可以观察到终末日历的形状有着明显的变化。
另外，这些实体的面具也会逐渐相应变化。
浮士德很好奇。我应该把这种转变作为我的下一个研究对象，
报告结束。
→嗯……喂，你是不是没有提它们抱着我们喷火的事情？有一个实体把我头发全烧了。
→喂！浮士德！我们不能把这些头部卖给哪个古董店吗？它们看起来不是挺值钱的吗？

我观察到其转变的最终程度了。
我们可以假设，它的面具有两种形态。
虽然这和终末日历的四个阶段比起来不算什么，但是它们之间的确有着不可分割的关联。
它似乎可以从它的面具中喷出火焰。在一次战斗后的尸检中，我们发现它的体内并没有什么易燃的材料，这也表明那火焰并不是通过物理手段形成的。
我们并没有更进一步的发现。
……真是可惜，浮士德希望知道更多东西。
→ 你在尸检的时候让我站岗站了好几个小时，你就对你发现的东西感到知足吧。

事情发生在我经过一片丛林时。
这是一片植被茂密的绿色荒野，充满着各种绮丽的蜜蜂和蝴蝶。
你可以在这种地方找到各种不可名状的生物。
举个例子，那朵花。
一般来说，植物是不可能仅靠自己移动的。一旦它在某处扎了根，那么它就要在那里度过它接下来的余生。
这也是人们认为的植物和动物的主要区别。
但这些"植物"就像是一群疯狂的野兽。
一些植物冲向了我们，就像抬起头一样抬起它们那带着尖牙的花。
它们的根部都转变成了枝干，起着和之前完全不同的作用，并且，它们身体上似乎没有任何用于存储营养的地方。
因此，这些瘦骨嶙峋的植物饥渴的寻找着他们的食物。
它们不断的向嘴中塞入食物，尽管它们无法吸收吃下去的任何一种食物……
多么诡异的一种生物啊。

它的外形像一颗石头。
我不确定拥有它这种质量大小的物体要如何移动。它的行为表现和外观可以说完全不遵循科学原理。但是现在回想起来，它也许还算是遵循了一点科学原理的。
它会突然悬浮在半空中然后一动不动。
它还会时不时转动它的眼球到中央。而当它愿意的时候，它也会把人给撞倒。
我完全不知道它移动的目的是什么。即便如此，我也在思考了解它移动的动机是否有必要。
这个类鹅卵石的物体有可能是个活物。
虽然没人会把它叫做生物。但话说回来，如果没人称我为生物，难道我就不是活的了？
或许与懒惰有关，
就像我们都懒得去思考它是否与我们所想的一样。
这个鹅卵石大概率是个懒惰的活物，
在这一点上，我也一样。

所以你想让我说一下那个尖尖的东西，对吧？
那玩意外形像一个脱水的触手……然后中间还有些红色的液体。
我用我的球棒狠狠地揍了那玩意一顿，不得不说这玩意比它看起来硬多了。
不过更大的问题是……这玩意的攻击方式有点奇怪。
它用它的长鼻子一样的东西戳着人，然后……它开始把红色的水射进人的身体里！
然后你就感觉到心被烧起来一样的疼，就好像空着肚子去干一些重活一样……让你感觉很不爽……像窒息了一样……
总之就是让你感觉很奇怪，让你看到什么东西都感到火大。
有些甚至被汁水一样的东西击中后发生了爆炸。我真心不想让那种事发生在我身上。
→可你不总是因为小事而生气吗？
→别把我惹毛了。

自打我成年以来就再也没写过观察日记，所以不知道能不能写好……
但，毕竟是命令。那……总之先从描述它的外貌开始？
嗯，好吧。首先那是一个苹果。
一个……十分诡异的长着肢体的巨大苹果。
说真的，难道你不觉得某种食物变得十分巨大或者自己长腿跑是一件很恶心的事情吗？难道只有我这么觉得？
噢，我跑题了。不管怎么说，那苹果是金色的。一眼就能看出它绝对不是从哪个普通果园里长出来的。嗯，对了，你们把这种东西叫做异想体对吧？
的确，那个苹果异想体正大摇大摆的四处闲逛呢。
我……我似乎有一种想冲上去把那苹果切碎的冲动，而且这种冲动还在不断涨大。就像是被什么磁力吸引了一样，我说不清。
……呵，估计也找不到比我还要恶心苹果的人。也许是因为我的过去有些特殊吧。
我们决定先撤退，因为目前拥有的情报尚且无法支持我们与其战斗。
也许最后我们还是得行动，到时候如果有新发现我也会写下来。
→怎么写的这么乱。你在军队的时候报告也写的这么烂吗？
→维吉尔让我们自由发挥。但丁也同意了了。
→……如果经理无所谓，那我也没意见。
[纸上留下了烟头烫出的痕迹]：只、小、怨。
→只是些小小的抱怨。

真是累死个人。
那东西一直在治疗自己，不管是切开，碾碎还是彻底破坏，试了各种方法都没用，可让我们吃了不少苦头。
单是和它战斗其实挺简单的……虽然我们还是有人受伤。它只会用它的身体向我们冲撞，只要习惯了这种攻击方式，处理起来也不难。
在和它战斗几次之后，我貌似发现了它的特点。你看啊，在它的周围飘着一些金色的光环对吧？
但是那光环在苹果治疗自己几次后就会消失。
也许这就是它再生的关键。
我去告诉经理看看。这样那磨人的战斗也能结束吧。

……[都市粗口]。这就是你让我来做观察记录的原因？
你知道会发生这种逼事……？
也是，你不可能料到……
因为我们，都是第一次见到。
哈啊……把那个苹果劈开后，从裂口能看到它的内部。
然后有一些[都市粗口]树枝从它分裂的地方弹出来……然后……那个混账东西它……
它带走了尤莉……
一大堆蛆虫在它体内聚集起来，就像是把尤莉当成了养分……
随后那些蛆虫“转变”成了一张丑陋的脸。
哈哈，是不是很搞笑？我甚至对那杂种产生了亲近感。可能是因为我们都是让人恶心的“虫子”吧。
一意识到这一点，我就坐不住了。我必须把那丑陋的脸撕碎才能解气。
然后……然后……
→看上去很难让格里高尔再冷静地写下去了，所以我暂时阻止了他。反正他也不能提供更多的信息了。
→在我用烟头灼烧那些蛆虫时，它们挣扎的要比我想的猛烈的多。这算不算个情报？

哈啊……把那个苹果劈开后，从裂口能看到它的内部。
然后有一些[都市粗口]树枝从它分裂的地方弹出来……然后……那个混账东西它……
它带走了尤莉……
一大堆蛆虫在它体内聚集起来，就像是把尤莉当成了养分……
随后那些蛆虫“转变”成了一张丑陋的脸。
哈哈，是不是很搞笑？我甚至对那杂种产生了亲近感。可能是因为我们都是让人恶心的“虫子”吧。
一意识到这一点，我就坐不住了。我必须把那丑陋的脸撕碎才能解气。
然后……然后……
→看上去很难让格里高尔再冷静地写下去了，所以我暂时阻止了他。反正他也不能提供更多的信息了。
→在我用烟头灼烧那些蛆虫时，它们挣扎的要比我想的猛烈的多。这算不算个情报？

一群穿着怪异的人从那收容箱中走了出来。
它们头上戴着锡制的罐头，而躯体则是由某种塑料制成的……
这很难说，就好是某人随意堆积起来的玩具一样。
在那些不和谐的色调之上，是直接暴露在外的机械结构。
它们也并不是仅由机器组成，
在组成部位之间，我看到了一些早已干枯的血肉……
那收容箱里到底发生了什么？
→嗯……也许那是某种全自动假体生产安装机？就像我父亲要收购的那家公司一样……算-算了。忘了我刚刚说的吧。
→异想体从来都不是什么普通设备一样的东西。我十分反对与那些跑出来的东西进行接触。

它们很坚硬。这些东西比看上去的要耐打的多。
我以为它们就像小孩子的玩具一样好解决，但我想错了……在我这烂透了的职业生涯中，我以为我已经见够离谱的东西了，看来我还是有很多东西要学。
一定有人类在那东西的里面……但它的行为就像是一个已经坏了的杀人机器一样。它们的上半身不停的旋转着，手臂也在以一种诡异的方式动着。
而且最主要的是……它们似乎感觉不到痛。
我听说，后巷里有人可以移除人的痛觉神经。这两者是相似的吗？
→正如我一直说的那样，每种异想体都有自己的归属，你不能用都市的标准来评判这些东西，以实玛利。
→至少，这些异想体还是以物理意义存在于这个世界上的。如果某些东西的属性并不受它们所处空间的法则的约束，那么，你能说这些东西是真实存在的吗？
→你他妈在瞎逼逼什么？
→我觉得你没必要明白这些，希斯克里夫。
→哈？我的名字被写在哪了吗？你怎么知道那是我？
→……有趣。[在纸上有几个用烟头烫出来的字]

我想我明白了什么。
当我靠近那些晕过去的罐头人时，我听到了机器运作的声音。听上去就好像内部构造正在被修复。
如果非要我猜的话……它们体内应该是装有什么自动修复设备。
但是，那设备似乎最多只能修复五处受损点。
问题是，每次它们被修好之后，都会变得比之前更强……
我们应该找个方法彻底解决它们，并让那修复机器停下来。在那之前，我们不得不承受住他们的五次自我修复。
噢，对了，
你觉得，作为‘人’的内部要怎么修复？
→不要怀疑异想体的身体构造。

嗯……书面工作是真没意思。
噢，不过我倒是挺喜欢把自己的经历写下来的。我以前挺烦我爷爷逼着我写日记的，但现在，倒是没那么讨厌了。
所以，我得描述那个异想体的外观，对吗？
首先……它眼神迷离，口水也在不断向外流出。
双眸和流出的口水颜色相同，那颜色和绑在它们身上的缎带颜色一样，都是粉红色的。
噢，说到缎带，触感是不是和丝绸很相似？
我们家有着和那颜色差不多的织物，虽然那不是最贵的……嗯，我想它也挺有价值的吧？
对了！我们用一些这样的东西来装饰我弟弟妹妹们的生日派对吧！

噢，看来那些人是这家公司以前的员工。
浮士德说，它们的衣着和工牌是前L公司制式的。
我的天，我是真没办法自己去抢一具尸体回来。
如果它向我袭来，我会让我的仆人去解决它。并且，我也绝不会用自己的眼去看那恶心的场景，我会让仆人向我描述那场景的。
噢……我一开始对死尸并不感兴趣，而现在我会仔细思考。
也许那缎带会让那些死去的人又活过来？
那些缎带在战斗中抓住了我们……
如果它在我们死时包裹住了我们，你觉得我们会变得像他们一样吗？

那些缎带在战斗中抓住了我们……
如果它在我们死时包裹住了我们，你觉得我们会变得像他们一样吗？

-他们由机械、塑料、锡以及电路组成。
-或红或粉的缎带缠绕在他们身上。
-一双粉红色的鞋子穿在他们的“脚”上。
-很明显，他们的“脚”是被强行塞进那鞋子里的。
-同时，我们还观测到异想体瞳孔颜色的改变以及散发出芳香的现象。
-在未来的报告中，我们将记录更多新的发现。
→妈的，这真你妈的无聊。

-我们发现，在持久战中，那些粉色的缎带会一点一点的把我们吞噬。
-被缎带大面积包裹的罪人将承受大量的伤害。
-一个值得注意的发现：因为异想体的攻击而死亡或受伤的友军会导致缠绕粉色缎带的异想体的复活。
-同时，只有伤亡人数达到一定程度时，才会引起异想体复活。
-我要求管理人分析这一状况，并给出应对的策略。
-在未来的报告中，我们将记录更多新的发现。

-有人猜测：这些头戴易拉罐的实体和那些缠着缎带的实体是相似的。
-也有人建议在受到大量伤害之前将缎带移除。
-测试该建议是否可行时，我与缎带进行了直接接触。
-缎带的质感并不是哪一种衣服或是纤维所能拥有的。
-有的感觉就像是枯萎的落叶，而有的缎带的质感就像是粗壮的树根。
-可以确定的是，那些缎带是活着的。
-缎带的反应会根据移除它的方式而改变。
-用蛮力移除，可以轻松的将缎带撕烂。
-没有更多的额外发现。观察记录结束。
→我太慌张了，我不时的撕扯着这些缎带，这本不应该这么棘手的。
→我一直很小心的对待它……担心会出什么岔子……但是那缎带突然变大包裹住了鸿璐。因为我，他……
→辛克莱~我没事的~，这真是个有趣的体验！

-该实体与昆虫相像，通体透明。
-我们无从明晰它存活所需的生理需求，甚至于能不能称它为生物体都仍待考量。
-它的透明躯体被水充满。
-通过观测，可以在其中发现一些类似器官的物体，但这些物体似乎无法真正起到器官的功效。
-其体内的水也未产生任何生物化学反应。
-这种液态躯体的新陈代谢或许已经完全停滞。
-该实体的面庞像是一名沉沦于思考的人类。又或许仅仅只是与某种浮游生物形似。
-长期的观测让我沉浸于思考之中。
-沉这个字……让我不由得回想起过去。
-……那种感觉可糟透了。

那些东西看上去像是堆恶心的肉块……
可在前端还有一个令人作呕的口器……一开始，我以为口里含着的是条舌头，可实际上却是一只手。
那只手由两条扭曲缠绕的手臂组成。我看见里面有只死死盯着我的眼睛。
就好似它仍未满足，渴望将我也一并吞噬殆尽，滋养自身的血肉。
虽然我无法听见话语，但我能知道它的想法。
……这已经不是它第一次这么看我了。

轮子时常被视作科技进步的象征。
它意味着人类已经意识到自己有能力去设想自然界中不存在的事物，并将其化为现实。
同时，这也是人类向高傲自负转变的开端。
这或许就是傲慢以轮子之形出现的原因。
钢铁铸成的圆弧永不停歇。
它从不在乎自己是否碾过他人的血肉，也从不在意自己是否将草地轧为齑粉。
因为，它能转动……
而其他东西不能。

所以现在轮到我了是吧？
想想也是，迟早要来~我之前看到过另一个伙计时不时写下一些东西，而小格里则在一旁一边记笔记一边臭着个脸……
哼，那位色收先生和浮士德告诉我们些信息又不会死……
算了，工作就是工作，大概吧。
哼……我不清楚该如何表达。它在外表上看起来像一个拿着镐子的人……但全身上下到处都是冰刺。
目前看下来也没什么特别奇怪的地方。我在我老家见过有人身上有比这个大得多的冰刺。
奇怪的事情是……他们的腿看上去像是来自一只鸡。
这……有什么寓意吗？

那把大鹤嘴锄变成了一把冰制大镰刀。
它巨大且锋利，就像童话故事中的死神随身携带的东西一样……
不过，他们挥舞它的方式并没有改变：把它举起来，再往下摆动。
只是，他们旨在开采我们的头骨，而不是矿脉。
而且我们能产出的不是金子银子，而是红色液体……
哇-哇，等一下。那孩子的头又炸开了！
→替她结个尾，之后辛克莱在经理的帮助下完全恢复了。

哼，那位色收先生和浮士德告诉我们些信息又不会死……
算了，工作就是工作，大概吧。
哼……我不清楚该如何表达。它在外表上看起来像一个拿着镐子的人……但全身上下到处都是冰刺。
目前看下来也没什么特别奇怪的地方。我在我老家见过有人身上有比这个大得多的冰刺。
奇怪的事情是……他们的腿看上去像是来自一只鸡。
这……有什么寓意吗？

那把大鹤嘴锄变成了一把冰制大镰刀。
它巨大且锋利，就像童话故事中的死神随身携带的东西一样……
不过，他们挥舞它的方式并没有改变：把它举起来，再往下摆动。
只是，他们旨在开采我们的头骨，而不是矿脉。
而且我们能产出的不是金子银子，而是红色液体……
哇-哇，等一下。那孩子的头又炸开了！
→替她结个尾，之后辛克莱在经理的帮助下完全恢复了。

我并不喜欢写东西，但是我没法拒绝上级的命令。
因此别向我抱怨什么有的没的，我写不出那种花里胡哨的词句。
首先……这些虫子看上去让我觉得恶心。
一种怪异的类似于粘土的物质覆盖在它们的前足和后足上……此外它们还长着一双让我很不爽的眼睛。
它们身上也有一些锋利如刀片般的部分——我不太确定这些部分是由体内弹出的骨骼构成，还是由身上的粘土风干了之后产生的。
我猜这就它们拿来四处捅人的武器，是吧？
哦对了，我们这不是也有个“虫子”吗？那东西和他的手臂看起来挺像的。
也许他能告诉你更多信息。
→……我不知道该从何说起，尽管我并不是很喜欢我的这只手臂，但是你不觉得拿我的手和那些粘土怪物作比较有点太过分了吗？
→如果你有什么不满，你可以和我当面聊聊。
→希斯克利夫，请不要再制造麻烦了。此外，攻击性语言不应该出现在观察记录里。
→是你逼着我写这些垃圾玩意的，现在我连决定我写什么的权力都没有了？那就换个人来干吧。

那个白发娘们总是来找我的麻烦，但我还是打算按照我自己的想法来写这些东西，这些虫子在今天的战斗中搞得我非常不爽。
那些圆溜溜的眼珠子……是的，那些生物并不是真的由粘土构成。
它们的肌肉……那肯定是肌肉，因为把那些东西撕成两半时的手感和我以前撕烂一个倒霉杂种时的感觉一模一样。
看起来那些附着在它们肢体上的肌肉束才是真正控制它们运动的东西，这些肌肉配合起来就像是一个整体。它们长在脸上的眼睛完全没有反应，但是胳膊上的那些眼睛会时不时的抽搐。
跟他们干架会稍微有些棘手。我习惯根据对手的目光来推测对方下一步的动作，因此它们身上的眼睛总会干扰到我的判断。不过，我并不介意受点小伤，只要我能加倍奉还回去就行。
除此以外……那些东西似乎仍能感受疼痛。每当我击中它们的时候，它们身上的肌肉都会颤抖，眼睛也会抽动一下……看上去它好像有点儿急了。
总之，它们就是些跳梁的小丑罢了。
→跳.丑是长什么样的？他们有艺术感吗？你勾起我的好奇心了。
→那只是后巷的一句俗语罢了……意思就是这家伙很可笑。
→我知道。只.玩。

通常来说，就算我们把那些家伙拆了，他们也能很快复原。但是那些肌肉块似乎没法那么快速的恢复。
我之前有一次把它手臂上的一大块肌肉狠狠的砸成了一滩肉泥。
虽然这并没能让它停止尝试攻击我，但是……它相对来说变得没那么危险了,呃，但我的意思不是说那东西就不危险了。
好吧，至少它没法再像之前那样把我们的人抓起来撕碎了。
对对，这就说得通了，就像要是我的刀坏了，我也就没法再拿它捅人了。

那里还有更骇人的东西，但我得先说清楚：
这家伙真的很恐怖。
它远远地看上去像一只野兽，但你要是靠近些，就不会再有兴趣了……它令人作呕，给人的观感就跟那些在郊区游荡的怪物一样。
成束的肌肉纤维从它的体表探出，像张皮毛一样裹着它的躯体；肋骨彻底颠倒扭转，刺出它的后背。
它的上臂——也有可能是腿——长得极像人类肢体，其运动方式却与人类不同。
是的，它是个怪物。
→汝确定那样的生命体在郊区活动？！
→不，你在郊区找不到那种东西的。
→呃，我从未……那汝为何要如此描述它呢？
→还有比这更糟糕的东西呢。

那些东西实在是太快了。它们的反应速度明显高于人类一般的水准。
它们还很聪明，不凭蛮力打斗……
而是选择给后排最弱的目标飞身一爪，然后快速逃跑。
我们上次迎战它们时便发生了这种事：当你下令让一名重伤的罪人撤退时，它们就跳向那个罪人，一把划开他的动脉，再飞速逃走，就好像它们理解了你的命令一样。
我不明白它们是如何对我发出的滴答声作出反应的……噢，也许扭曲听取信息的方式与我们不同吧。

就算有大量的怪物向我们袭来，我们也应当保持冷静。
可能会有一两个罪人会在战斗中死亡，但……这是必要的牺牲。至少我们可以复活再来。
我记得上回你打算一次性解决它们的时候遇到了不少麻烦，我们也因此都被杀掉了。这种怪物似乎愈战愈勇，你越攻击它们，它们反而变得越强。
啊，说起我的死亡……
我想到那些东西把我的肠子咬开的瞬间。
我好像在能感到疼痛之前死去了，但怎么说呢……感觉像是坠入了无底的火坑。
那感觉并不灼热，反倒是……
置身烈焰竟让人觉得很自然。
我觉得能早点复活，少些这样的体验也挺不错的。谢谢经理了。

我并不喜欢写东西，但是我没法拒绝上级的命令。
因此别向我抱怨什么有的没的，我写不出那种花里胡哨的词句。

也许他能告诉你更多信息。

那感觉并不灼热，反倒是……
置身烈焰竟让人觉得很自然。
我觉得能早点复活，少些这样的体验也挺不错的。谢谢经理了。

噫，你一定是在开玩笑....我为什么非得观察这玩意，还要写一份记录？
我很讨厌这种~爬虫之类的小东西……我没法忍受它们。
哦当然，你不算，我亲爱的格雷格~
不管怎么说，我们总得和它们战斗，所以我完成了观察它们的职责。
嗯……首先，有一大群的蛇。
这怪物把这些巨蛇当做手臂，然后……呕，它们一直在吐信子。难道那些是"手指"吗？
不仅如此，许多更小的蛇正从盔甲中探出头来。
这盔甲里该不会全是蛇吧？
哇啊，我可不愿想象那画面！

这不是真的吧！真是瞎胡闹！！
你能相信吗？那个被用作手臂的蛇抓向了我！
哼……我没法冷静下来。
那条手臂……我是说，那条巨蛇，一下子伸过来把我缠住。
那冰冷滑腻的东西碰了我……
太恶心了，与其想这些不如让我死了算了！
它们扼上我的脖颈，我挣扎着呼吸，然后……
噁，吊在那怪物身上的小蛇都向我袭来！
撕咬、刺痛……啊，实在是混乱不堪。
我不记得自己何时死去，又何时复生……
但我这辈子也忘不掉那场景了……
亲爱的但丁，下次和它们战斗的时候，能不能把我安排在后方呀~？
→当然，我想不用我提醒你，但丁，你应当有所选择地同意罪人们的一些请求。
→你是不是轻视我们的经理了？如果他指示你换位置，你就得换，不管是换到前面还是后面。明白吗？

那些蛇……它们甚至不会死亡。
我确信自己解决了这怪物，但它吐着信子，挺立如初。
难道这是什么绝命抵抗之类的吗……不是，你得活得好好的才能如此顽强坚挺吧？
已死之躯还能怎么殊"死"搏斗呢？
真是吓坏我了，我没法保持平静！如果它们不是蛇我还稍能接受些！

我真的不喜欢写这些记录……
但如果这是要求的话……我会写的。
我此前从未与克罗默交过手，也没见过N公司士兵战斗的样子……不过据我所知，她总是随身带着一把剑，大概会点剑术。
至于她的样貌……和我印象中没太大区别，只是现在更高了些……
还有她那震耳发聩的笑声，持续轰鸣、令人颠倒错乱……
呃啊，我能先到此为止吗？
→这段记录没什么用处。

那个混蛋，她杀了我们的罪人们！
她已经杀穿了后排……
现在她又吹着那可恶的口哨……向我走来……
我什么都做不了……那声音让我直僵在原地……
我只能眼睁睁看着克罗默屠杀其他伙伴……
理智告诉我我现在极想碾碎她的头颅……但我的身体完全无法动弹。
我到底该怎么做……你能告诉我吗，经理？

我……
我仍然对克罗默深感畏惧。
光是迎着她的脸我就面部抽搐，她的刀让我不寒而栗。
她那双充斥着疯狂的眼睛让我不断回想起圣诞夜发生的惨剧，看到她诡异的笑容我还是会瑟瑟发抖。
但……
但我不会再害怕了。
我的意志现在能够抵抗她的口哨声了。
她的恶行太过肮脏，我绝不会再袖手旁观；若放那恶鬼安然离开，我也无颜面对被她杀死的罪人们。
自离开克罗默以后，我已经改变了许多。
我经历了很多死亡，也亲手了结了很多生命。
现在，我也可以彻底疯狂了。
所以，我一定……
我一定要用木桩狠狠洞穿她的胸膛，一遍又一遍地将她洞穿。
→这样的心态很好，我很喜欢。
→尽管你愿意直面战斗的心态令人敬佩，但这份记录是用于记载你观察得出的客观结果，而非个人主观的决心表达。
→抱歉……我下次会改正的。

dataList.name: 梦想着完整人类的克罗默

storyList.story:
当我仔细回想时，我意识到克罗默一直以来对肉体都有种近乎狂热的痴迷。
而这种痴迷不断积累，最终造就了我们现在看到的东西……一个阴森骇人、令人作呕的怪物。
在这一切发生之前……我同意她的观点。将一部分血肉之躯用别的什么东西代替，这种想法曾让我感到不适。
但是现在，我明白了——真正可憎的，是坚信只有自己才是唯一正道的荒谬思想……并任由自己沦陷于这种盲目的信仰。

它有着鱼的外貌。
-不过它的头部被砍去了。
-那断面整齐利落，应该是由一种单边开刃的器具造成的，比如一柄短刀，或是镰刀。
-尽管失去了头部，它仍在运动。我知道，对于异想体这种生物来说，有无独立的脑袋与其运动能力没有任何关联，但我还是打算写下这句话。
-在它的胸部区域，可以看见一个膨胀的液囊。我们无法对其进行进一步观察。
-如果有任何新的发现，我会在未来的报告中提及。

从其胸口处隆起的液囊中隐约可以看见某种物体的轮廓。
-该物体外形似花，又像人类的神经中枢。
-它可以鼓起液囊来将其用作钝器，也能够快速挤压液囊，射出其中的液体。
-总的来说，液囊在其的攻击行为中起到主要作用。因此迅速破坏它应当是种高效的战斗策略。
-如果有任何新的发现，我会在未来的报告中提及。

我将会在下文中描述这家伙给我留下的印象。
从外观来看，它类似于由三头通体乌黑的狼以某种精密技艺缝合而成的生物。不，它的嘴不止三张——实际的缝合数也许更多。
在这只犬科生物的头部之上是一具人身，由于遭到了严重的烧灼已经无法清晰辨认了。尽管一般来说，这种程度的燃烧已足以使任何自然躯体灰飞烟灭，但这家伙要多结实有多结实，它的肌肉甚至仍有所动作。
除此之外，就像处刑犯人时会做的那样，一排木制的电线杆被穿入了那匹狼的身体里。它们时不时会释放电流，但我怎么也想不明白这些电是从哪来的。
以上。

我曾与它交战过。
它像是着了魔一样飞速向我冲来。
它的神情既不像听令去战斗的猎犬，也与野兽为求果腹狩猎的样子不同。
这副表情让我觉得，它除了冲向我之外也许别无选择。
我看见一条紫色的电弧窜上它的后背。这让我想起曾经在实验室里做过类似的生物实验。
电激能够控制动物的躯体，使它们听凭他人的意志运动。
我不禁怀疑这种生物是否也在遭受同样的操纵。
虽然它用爪子重伤了我，但我还是有点同情它的。
以上。

它的嚎叫如雷贯耳。
具体描述一下那情景：闪电汇聚一端，就像是世上的所有雷霆都同时劈中了它；因此我说它的嚎叫“如雷贯耳”实在不算夸大。
我于是得以理解它身上的电能从何而来。
这个生物就像是一个活体电池。它把闪电吸收进自己的身体里，并将其作为自己运作的动力。
哎，可它使用这些电能却非出于自身意志，强化自己的力量什么的；
它的行动为体内积攒的电能所控，让我觉得它是在履行上天的意志。
当我写下这些想法时，浮士德小姐提醒了我，对异想体产生这种认识是错误的。
因此，我用这段话作结，以防我的观察记录过于富有感性色彩。

噫，你一定是在开玩笑....我为什么非得观察这玩意，还要写一份记录？
我很讨厌这种~爬虫之类的小东西……我没法忍受它们。
哦当然，你不算，我亲爱的格雷格~
不管怎么说，我们总得和它们战斗，所以我完成了观察它们的职责。
嗯……首先，有一大群的蛇。
这怪物把这些巨蛇当做手臂，然后……呕，它们一直在吐信子。难道那些是"手指"吗？
不仅如此，许多更小的蛇正从盔甲中探出头来。
这盔甲里该不会全是蛇吧？
哇啊，我可不愿想象那画面！

这不是真的吧！真是瞎胡闹！！
你能相信吗？那个被用作手臂的蛇抓向了我！
哼……我没法冷静下来。
那条手臂……我是说，那条巨蛇，一下子伸过来把我缠住。
那冰冷滑腻的东西碰了我……
太恶心了，与其想这些不如让我死了算了！
它们扼上我的脖颈，我挣扎着呼吸，然后……
噁，吊在那怪物身上的小蛇都向我袭来！
撕咬、刺痛……啊，实在是混乱不堪。
我不记得自己何时死去，又何时复生……
但我这辈子也忘不掉那场景了……
亲爱的但丁，下次和它们战斗的时候，能不能把我安排在后方呀~？
→当然，我想不用我提醒你，但丁，你应当有所选择地同意罪人们的一些请求。
→你是不是轻视我们的经理了？如果他指示你换位置，你就得换，不管是换到前面还是后面。明白吗？

那些蛇……它们甚至不会死亡。
我确信自己解决了这怪物，但它吐着信子，挺立如初。
难道这是什么绝命抵抗之类的吗……不是，你得活得好好的才能如此顽强坚挺吧？
已死之躯还能怎么殊"死"搏斗呢？
真是吓坏我了，我没法保持平静！如果它们不是蛇我还稍能接受些！

dataList.name: Ebony Queen’s Apple
dataList.clue:
The thorny creepers covering the area seem to be connected to the vines constituting its legs.
Perhaps damaging the legs could get rid of the overgrowth somehow?

storyList.story:
Recording the information gained from an encounter with the entity.
<Company Rules> Article 11, Paragraph 2 states I am to categorize it as an Abnormality.
When first faced with the Sinners, the Abnormality didn't show signs of hostility. Instead, it initiated a direct communictation through the psyche.
Out of all the languages I knew, the Abnormality appeared to use my most commonly used one. I did not see sound-producing organs like the mouth or a vocal cord in motion.
"Bring the Snow White," spoke the Abnormality. A report on the former L Corp. I analyzed after disengaging suggests that it has a connection with F-04-42.
In addition, I discovered a corpse that seemed to belong to the staff that arrived here before us for preliminary investigation. Their ID confirmed that they were from the Operations Planning department, so we retrieved the remains and left the scene before a battle could break out.
Concluding the report.

Recording the information gained from encountering the entity in battle.
<Company Rules> Article 11, Paragraph 3 states I am to designate its risk level as WAW. This is based on the managerial procedures retrieved from the branch facility.
I will describe its behavior during combat.
It attacks using growths of vines. It wraps its vines around itself as well, forming a shape that resembles a dress; it's possible that it believes itself to be a "noble".
Its vines are used in a variety of ways, such as persistently stabbing one Sinner, and rising from the floor to injure multiple Sinners.
In addition, its sturdy exterior made it difficult to damage.
In one battle where many Sinners were lost, we managed to remove one of its arms (As I could most aptly describe). I found that it could no longer perform the attack that targets all Sinners.
I will record any additional discoveries I observe in future encounters.
Concluding the report.

Recording an additional significant discovery.
We were able to remove its head during an encounter.
We did not initially consider the head a target as its height was considerably higher than the Sinners' reach, Heathcliff's unstoppable advance provided a helpful clue.
We were able to successfully destroy its head. Though Heathcliff's head was destroyed as well, it should be a negligible loss since that one is a renewable asset.
It continued to move and attack despite the lack of a head, but we found that its exterior became significantly soft.
Removing its "limbs" became a much more manageable task.
Although the head grew back after a period of time, the removal of its arms and legs in the meantime freed us from the threat of powerful attacks for the rest of the operation.
Concluding the report.

It has the appearance of a fish.
-Its head has been cut off.
-The cut surface is clean; it appears to have been done with a single-sided edge, such as a knife or a scythe.
-It exhibits motion in spite of the lack of a head. I am aware that whether or not an Abnormality has an intact head is completely irrelevant to its ability to show activity, but I will note this regardless.
-An inflated sack visible around the chest area. Could not make clear observation.
-Will note new discoveries in a future report.

A silhouette is observed inside the inflated sack around the chest.
-It bears resemblance to a flower, or the central nervous system of a human.
-It expands the sack to use as blunt instrument, and can squeeze it at high speed to expel liquid.
-Overall, the sack is deemed to be a major component of its attacks; quick destruction should prove effective.
-Will note new discoveries in a future report.

Last time I wrote an observation log, I was a kid, so I'm not sure if I'm up to this, but...
I guess orders are orders.
So, uhh... Start with describing its appearance?
Hm, alright. That was an apple.
A huge, grotesque apple with limbs.
Personally speaking, doesn't it freak you out when a food item gets all massive or starts walking on its own? Is it just me?
I went off-topic there. Anyway, that apple was golden. Definitely not something out of your average orchard. Mmm, right. It's what you call an Abnormality, yeah?
Then yeah, that apple Abnormality was strutting all by itself.
So I... I was getting a growing urge to chop that apple. It was almost magnetic. Hard to explain.
...Well, you won't find a lot of people who hate apples as much as I do. I guess that's on my unusual past.
We decided to fall back for now since we had too little intel to try and fight.
We'll probably take on it at some point, so I'll write down more when that time comes.
→ How disorganized. Were your reports as terrible during your military service?
→ Vergilius instructed us to write these however we wanted. Dante agreed with that, too.
→ …If Executive Manager is fine with it, I won't object.
→ [A cigarette burn is left on the paper.] S.P.C.
→ Seriously, some petty complaint that was.

Man, that was tiring.
It kept healing itself or whatever, it just wouldn't fall after we sliced, tore, smashed, and did all kinds of damage to it.
Fighting it was pretty simple... Well, it's not like all of us got out unscathed, though. What it does is run into us for a body slam. Not too hard to deal with once you're used to it.
I think I get its schtick after fighting it a few times. You see, it's got a golden aura floating around it, yeah?
But the aura was gone after the apple recovered several times.
Maybe that's its threshold of regeneration.
I'll let manager bud know about this. It might be what helps end this tedious struggle.

…[What appears to be foul words are scribbled out.]. This is why you put me in charge of the observation?
Did you know this crap would happen and…
Yeah, no. There's no way you could have…
None of us could, this was our first time.
Gah… When I blew that golden apple up, it split open.
Then some [What appears to be foul words are scribbled out.]ed branches popped out of the crack, and… That thing, that bastard…
It took Yuri…
And with that new nutrient, a swarm of maggots piled up inside…
"Metamorphosing" into a hideous face.
Haha, funny, isn't it. I was feeling a sense of kinship with that crawler. I guess it's because we were both pests…
Realizing that, I just couldn't stay calm. I had to tear that detestable face apart to find peace.
And then, and then...
→ Gregor was struggling to maintain his cool in his writing, so I relieved him of his pen. He didn't have much else to offer in terms of information, anyway.
→ Those maggots squirmed harder than I expected when I scorched 'em with my cigarette. Does this count as intel?

I will describe my impressions of the encounter with this.
It has the appearance of three dark-furred wolves stitched together in a delicate operation. No, there may have been more, as it possessed more than three mouths.
Atop the canine heads was the figure of a person, charred beyond recognition. Though a combustion of that degree normally would have reduced such a figure to ashes, its form was as solid as it could be, its muscles even showing motion.
In addition, a heap of wooden telephone poles are lodged into the wolves' body as stakes would a prisoner. They seem to periodically emit electricity, but I couldn't fathom through what means they were able to do so.
Such is all I have to say.

I had an opportunity to engage it in combat.
It ran at me, galloping in a possessed motion.
Its visage was a far cry from a hound commanded to battle or a beast yearning to feed itself.
Running at me may have been its only choice.
I saw a purple arc of electricity sprint across its back. Which reminded me of animals tested under similar conditions in the laboratory.
Using electric stimuli, those animals were made to move as some other being intended.
It made me wonder if the same is happening to this creature.
While its claws hurt me gravely, I felt an ounce of pity for it as well.
Such is all I have to say.

It had a thunderous roar.
To describe it in more detail, it gathered bolts of lightning as if all the storms and thunders in the world struck it at once, so it wouldn't be an exaggeration to say that its roar has a thunderous property.
Naturally, I was able to identify the source of its electricity.
This creature was like a living battery. Collecting lightning in its body, it used the power to fuel itself.
Alas, its usage of the lightning's energy was not for a self-motivated purpose such as pursuit of strength;
the accumulated electric forces appeared to dictate its motion, giving me the impression that it was the will of the sky that it followed.
While drawing up such thoughts, Miss Faust reminded me that it's not right to have such impressions of Abnormalities.
Thus, I conclude the log here lest it becomes too sentimental.

A bunch of creeps walked out of that container box.
Wearing tin cans on their heads, torsos made up of some sort of plastic...
It's hard to explain. It was like someone arbitrarily put together pieces of random toys.
On top of unmatching colors, some straight up lacked frames to cover up the mechanisms.
They weren't all machines, either.
Between the parts, I saw bits of flesh and dried blood...
Just what is going on inside that box?
→ Umm... Maybe it's a type of automated prosthetic procedure device? A company my father considered buying was… N-Never mind. Forget I said anything.
→ Abnormalities are not real devices. I recommend against trying to make ties with existing things.

They're tough. These things are way tougher than they look.
I thought they'd be as easy to deal with as children's toys, but I way misjudged... I thought I'd seen my share of extraordinary things throughout my career of unpleasant jobs, but it looks like I still have much to see and learn.
There has to be a human inside… but they acted like broken killing machines. Their upper body rotates all the way round, and their arms moved weirdly, too.
And most of all… It's like they're incapable of feeling pain.
I heard some alleys in the Backstreets provide a surgery that fries pain receptors. Could this be similar?
→ As I repeatedly assert, Abnormalities are entities of their own category. You shouldn't construe them with the City's standards, Ishmael.
→ And yet Abnormalities physically exist in this realm. If the properties of a thing aren't determined by the laws of the space it exists in, can it truly be said to exist?
→ The hell are you yapping on about?
→ I don't believe it's necessary for you to understand, Heathcliff.
→ Huh? Is my name written here somewhere? How'd you know it was me?
→ …Funny. [A cigarette burn is left on the paper.]

I think I have an idea now.
When I approached the fainted tin men, I heard mechanical noises. It sounded like things were being fixed within.
If I had to guess… They seem to be equipped with devices that automatically repair their bodies.
But, the device didn't seem capable of carrying out more than five repairs.
Only trouble is that they grow stronger each time they're fixed up…
We should find a way to deal with them and stop this repair mechanism from getting to work. Until then, we'll have to bear with their five lives…
Oh, by the way:
How do you think the 'human' parts inside are being repaired?
→ Do not question the physics of Abnormalities.

Hmm... Writing is rather tedious work.
Oh, but I do suppose it's not a bad idea to write down my experiences. I hated when my grandfather scolded and pestered me into keeping a diary, but now, I'm not so averse to the thought.
So, I have to describe the appearance of that Abnormality, right?
Firstly... Its eyes were out of focus. It was drooling from the mouth, too.
Something about the color of the eyes and the saliva was off as well. They were all pink, same as the ribbon wrapped around the body.
Oh, speaking of ribbons, doesn't it bear a striking resemblance to silk?
I think our family kept a similar color of fabric. Though it wasn't the most luxurious... Hm, I do guess it's valuable in its own right.
Right, that's it! We used something like this for decoration on our younger sibling's birthday!

Oh dear, it looks like these used to be employees of this company.
Faust said that their outfits and employee IDs belonged to the former L Corp.
Goodness, I can't possibly imagine looting a corpse myself.
If it came down to me, I would've ordered a servant to handle the task. And I would have looked away from that gross sight and told the servant to explain it with words.
Oh... I wouldn't have taken interest in dead bodies in the first place, now that I think about it.
Could these deceased people be animated by those ribbons, perhaps?
The ribbons that grab us as we fight them...
If they wrap around us when we die, do you think we'll become like them?

dataList.name: You Want To Get Beat? Hurtily?

storyList.story:
-Composed of machinery, tin, plastic, steel, and circuits.
-Red or pink ribbons are coiled around the body.
-A pair of pink shoes are worn around the parts thought to be feet.
-The feet appear to have been forcibly shoved into the pink shoes.
-Anomalies observed in the color and direction of pupils in all entities.
-Will note new discoveries in a future report.
→ Damn, that's awful dry.

-Observed the pink ribbons encroach on us in prolonged combat.
-Sinners covered with a large quantity of ribbons were subject to heavily damaging attacks.
-Notable discovery: casualty from the attack caused the entities wearing pink ribbons to reanimate.
-The reanimation is thought to occur after a certain number of casualties.
-I request that the manager analyze the incidence and determine the tactical approach.
-Will note new discoveries in a future report.

-There is little doubt that this tin entity and those covered in ribbons shared the same state.
-Peer suggested that the ribbons be removed before it poses serious danger.
-I came in direct content with the ribbon while attempting the suggested solution.
-The ribbon did not have the texture of cloth or any other kind of fabric.
-Some resembled withered leaves, while others gave the tactile impression of a strong plant stem.
-One unambiguous conclusion is that the ribbons are alive.
-The ribbon's reaction to removal appeared to depend on the method of handling.
-Removal with force seemed to make the ribbon crumble more easily.
-No further discoveries to be made; the observation log is concluded.
→ I got into a panic and ripped them haphazardly, but it wasn't actually that tricky.
→ I was careful about it, worried that it might go wrong… But then the ribbon expanded all of a sudden and wrapped Hong Lu. Because of me, he…
→ I'm all okay, Sinclair~ It was a unique and fun experience!

I was ordered to describe facts about this in detail.
So I observed.
Placed on a wooden pedestal that seemed as though it was woven from fibers of muscles was a large stone plate.
As I approached it, its compartments of bricks began to rattle.
Seized by curiosity, I attempted to step closer for a better look...
Alas, my colleagues strongly discouraged me from doing so, so I turned away.
One thing I can say with confidence is that it was likely a tool for predicting a date of some kind, judging from the many letters carved on the bricks.
Such is all I have to say.
→ Those letters are from an ancient language. If Yi Sang's depiction is correct, that plate is almost certainly a calendar.

I had an opportunity to engage it in combat.
Though it may have been less than pleasant as an observer to see the object of study sustain damage, more discoveries could be had in the behaviors it displayed during battle.
It summoned a number of flesh dolls wearing stone masks made of what I believe is the same mineral as the plate.
By 'offering' these dolls to the plate, I was able to observe a change in its shape.
The rattling bricks gradually widened, and I could see red muscle fibers and strange spatial extensions...or such.
I can't say for sure how drastic the change will be, but an observable trend is that it's becoming more and more ominous.
Such is all I have to say.
→ Why the hell did you put me in instead of those masked blokes? You damned clockhead, I'll #%^&@[The rest is neatly censored with a correction tape.]
→ Dante made the right choice. From what I can see, it seems that those flesh dolls, or "clay dolls," can't be offered up while they're alive. The only other option we have is to sacrifice Sinners.
→ And why does that have to be me @(##$[The rest is neatly censored with a correction tape.]

I had an opportunity to be offered to this.
I am about to describe the disconcerting, wet, and abnormal experience here.
I took unwavering steps forward as the choice was reasonable. I had no reason to fear, for I would be brought back to life even if I were to perish.
I did not feel the death, so to speak. Though I have experienced death many times in battle, I was not subjected to the sort of pain or flashing disarray that normally accompanies a demise that time. It simply felt as though I was being transported to a different location.
It may be the universe or some other dimension.
My own body and voice couldn't be perceived by my senses. Perhaps my eyes had gone and I became part of that place.
There, I may have seen the end. You could say it was a doomsday I witnessed.
No perhaps I may have been the end and the doomsday I was present at the end but not existent and while it may be misleading to say that it was there but even still I witnessed man and sky and earth tear into thousands of pieces
[The rest is neatly censored with a correction tape.]
→ I had Yi Sang talk with the recovery staff from After Team for a moment. His psychological corruption seems rather severe. Dante, I think we should refrain from making our observers directly experience these events from now on.

Recording the information gained from an encounter with the entity.
<Company Rules> Article 11, Paragraph 2 states I am to categorize it as an Abnormality.
<Company Rules> Article 11, Paragraph 2, Addendum 3 states I am to categorize it as a subordinate entity of the stone plate Abnormality.
It wore a mask that resembled a crude diver's helmet. It appeared to be made of a stone with high hardness, its exterior well polished.
Correction: rather than polished, it appears to have been "made that way". I was unable to detect any signs of artificial processing.
Its body resembled muscle fibers. The lack of skin or other protective surface makes it appear highly fragile, but a large number of these entities are expected to be more difficult to deal with.
Concluding the report.
I will report findings from a direct confrontation next time.

I encountered the entity in battle.
<Company Rules> Article 11, Paragraph 3 states I am to designate its risk level as TETH.
I will describe its behavior during combat.
The entities appear to use their thin yet elastic body for quick attacks.
They often charged into Sinners and grabbed their target tight. They were difficult to remove, and a few lives were lost due to their persistence.
As stated in the previous report, the entity appears to be closely related to the stone plate Abnormality. When the entities were killed and 'offered' to the stone plate Abnormality, a change in the plate's shape could be observed.
In addition, the masks of these entities gradually changed accordingly.
Faust is curious. I should make it my next task to study the extent of this transformation.
Concluding the report.
→ Um, hello, aren't you forgetting to mention the part where they hug us and belch fire? One of them burnt all my hair.
→ Hey Faust! Can't we sell these heads to an antique shop? Don't they look pretty pricey?

I observed the full extent of its changes.
Its mask had two forms it could assume.
While not as impressive as the four states the stone plate Abnormality could take, there was an undeniable connection between them.
It seems to be able to generate fire from within the mask. An autopsy after battle revealed no combustible materials stored inside, suggesting that the fire was not created via physical means.
No further discoveries were made.
...A shame, Faust was hoping to learn more things.
→ You made me stand guard for hours while you dissected their bodies, try to be happy with what you got.

dataList.name: Ebony Queen’s Apple
dataList.clue:
The thorny creepers covering the area seem to be connected to the vines constituting its legs.
Perhaps damaging the legs could get rid of the overgrowth somehow?

storyList.story:
Recording the information gained from an encounter with the entity.
<Company Rules> Article 11, Paragraph 2 states I am to categorize it as an Abnormality.
When first faced with the Sinners, the Abnormality didn't show signs of hostility. Instead, it initiated a direct communictation through the psyche.
Out of all the languages I knew, the Abnormality appeared to use my most commonly used one. I did not see sound-producing organs like the mouth or a vocal cord in motion.
"Bring the Snow White," spoke the Abnormality. A report on the former L Corp. I analyzed after disengaging suggests that it has a connection with F-04-42.
In addition, I discovered a corpse that seemed to belong to the staff that arrived here before us for preliminary investigation. Their ID confirmed that they were from the Operations Planning department, so we retrieved the remains and left the scene before a battle could break out.
Concluding the report.

Recording the information gained from encountering the entity in battle.
<Company Rules> Article 11, Paragraph 3 states I am to designate its risk level as WAW. This is based on the managerial procedures retrieved from the branch facility.
I will describe its behavior during combat.
It attacks using growths of vines. It wraps its vines around itself as well, forming a shape that resembles a dress; it's possible that it believes itself to be a "noble".
Its vines are used in a variety of ways, such as persistently stabbing one Sinner, and rising from the floor to injure multiple Sinners.
In addition, its sturdy exterior made it difficult to damage.
In one battle where many Sinners were lost, we managed to remove one of its arms (As I could most aptly describe). I found that it could no longer perform the attack that targets all Sinners.
I will record any additional discoveries I observe in future encounters.
Concluding the report.

Recording an additional significant discovery.
We were able to remove its head during an encounter.
We did not initially consider the head a target as its height was considerably higher than the Sinners' reach, Heathcliff's unstoppable advance provided a helpful clue.
We were able to successfully destroy its head. Though Heathcliff's head was destroyed as well, it should be a negligible loss since that one is a renewable asset.
It continued to move and attack despite the lack of a head, but we found that its exterior became significantly soft.
Removing its "limbs" became a much more manageable task.
Although the head grew back after a period of time, the removal of its arms and legs in the meantime freed us from the threat of powerful attacks for the rest of the operation.
Concluding the report.

It has the appearance of a fish.
-Its head has been cut off.
-The cut surface is clean; it appears to have been done with a single-sided edge, such as a knife or a scythe.
-It exhibits motion in spite of the lack of a head. I am aware that whether or not an Abnormality has an intact head is completely irrelevant to its ability to show activity, but I will note this regardless.
-An inflated sack visible around the chest area. Could not make clear observation.
-Will note new discoveries in a future report.

A silhouette is observed inside the inflated sack around the chest.
-It bears resemblance to a flower, or the central nervous system of a human.
-It expands the sack to use as blunt instrument, and can squeeze it at high speed to expel liquid.
-Overall, the sack is deemed to be a major component of its attacks; quick destruction should prove effective.
-Will note new discoveries in a future report.

Last time I wrote an observation log, I was a kid, so I'm not sure if I'm up to this, but...
I guess orders are orders.
So, uhh... Start with describing its appearance?
Hm, alright. That was an apple.
A huge, grotesque apple with limbs.
Personally speaking, doesn't it freak you out when a food item gets all massive or starts walking on its own? Is it just me?
I went off-topic there. Anyway, that apple was golden. Definitely not something out of your average orchard. Mmm, right. It's what you call an Abnormality, yeah?
Then yeah, that apple Abnormality was strutting all by itself.
So I... I was getting a growing urge to chop that apple. It was almost magnetic. Hard to explain.
...Well, you won't find a lot of people who hate apples as much as I do. I guess that's on my unusual past.
We decided to fall back for now since we had too little intel to try and fight.
We'll probably take on it at some point, so I'll write down more when that time comes.
→ How disorganized. Were your reports as terrible during your military service?
→ Vergilius instructed us to write these however we wanted. Dante agreed with that, too.
→ …If Executive Manager is fine with it, I won't object.
→ [A cigarette burn is left on the paper.] S.P.C.
→ Seriously, some petty complaint that was.

Man, that was tiring.
It kept healing itself or whatever, it just wouldn't fall after we sliced, tore, smashed, and did all kinds of damage to it.
Fighting it was pretty simple... Well, it's not like all of us got out unscathed, though. What it does is run into us for a body slam. Not too hard to deal with once you're used to it.
I think I get its schtick after fighting it a few times. You see, it's got a golden aura floating around it, yeah?
But the aura was gone after the apple recovered several times.
Maybe that's its threshold of regeneration.
I'll let manager bud know about this. It might be what helps end this tedious struggle.

…[What appears to be foul words are scribbled out.]. This is why you put me in charge of the observation?
Did you know this crap would happen and…
Yeah, no. There's no way you could have…
None of us could, this was our first time.
Gah… When I blew that golden apple up, it split open.
Then some [What appears to be foul words are scribbled out.]ed branches popped out of the crack, and… That thing, that bastard…
It took Yuri…
And with that new nutrient, a swarm of maggots piled up inside…
"Metamorphosing" into a hideous face.
Haha, funny, isn't it. I was feeling a sense of kinship with that crawler. I guess it's because we were both pests…
Realizing that, I just couldn't stay calm. I had to tear that detestable face apart to find peace.
And then, and then...
→ Gregor was struggling to maintain his cool in his writing, so I relieved him of his pen. He didn't have much else to offer in terms of information, anyway.
→ Those maggots squirmed harder than I expected when I scorched 'em with my cigarette. Does this count as intel?

I will describe my impressions of the encounter with this.
It has the appearance of three dark-furred wolves stitched together in a delicate operation. No, there may have been more, as it possessed more than three mouths.
Atop the canine heads was the figure of a person, charred beyond recognition. Though a combustion of that degree normally would have reduced such a figure to ashes, its form was as solid as it could be, its muscles even showing motion.
In addition, a heap of wooden telephone poles are lodged into the wolves' body as stakes would a prisoner. They seem to periodically emit electricity, but I couldn't fathom through what means they were able to do so.
Such is all I have to say.

I had an opportunity to engage it in combat.
It ran at me, galloping in a possessed motion.
Its visage was a far cry from a hound commanded to battle or a beast yearning to feed itself.
Running at me may have been its only choice.
I saw a purple arc of electricity sprint across its back. Which reminded me of animals tested under similar conditions in the laboratory.
Using electric stimuli, those animals were made to move as some other being intended.
It made me wonder if the same is happening to this creature.
While its claws hurt me gravely, I felt an ounce of pity for it as well.
Such is all I have to say.

It had a thunderous roar.
To describe it in more detail, it gathered bolts of lightning as if all the storms and thunders in the world struck it at once, so it wouldn't be an exaggeration to say that its roar has a thunderous property.
Naturally, I was able to identify the source of its electricity.
This creature was like a living battery. Collecting lightning in its body, it used the power to fuel itself.
Alas, its usage of the lightning's energy was not for a self-motivated purpose such as pursuit of strength;
the accumulated electric forces appeared to dictate its motion, giving me the impression that it was the will of the sky that it followed.
While drawing up such thoughts, Miss Faust reminded me that it's not right to have such impressions of Abnormalities.
Thus, I conclude the log here lest it becomes too sentimental.

A bunch of creeps walked out of that container box.
Wearing tin cans on their heads, torsos made up of some sort of plastic...
It's hard to explain. It was like someone arbitrarily put together pieces of random toys.
On top of unmatching colors, some straight up lacked frames to cover up the mechanisms.
They weren't all machines, either.
Between the parts, I saw bits of flesh and dried blood...
Just what is going on inside that box?
→ Umm... Maybe it's a type of automated prosthetic procedure device? A company my father considered buying was… N-Never mind. Forget I said anything.
→ Abnormalities are not real devices. I recommend against trying to make ties with existing things.

They're tough. These things are way tougher than they look.
I thought they'd be as easy to deal with as children's toys, but I way misjudged... I thought I'd seen my share of extraordinary things throughout my career of unpleasant jobs, but it looks like I still have much to see and learn.
There has to be a human inside… but they acted like broken killing machines. Their upper body rotates all the way round, and their arms moved weirdly, too.
And most of all… It's like they're incapable of feeling pain.
I heard some alleys in the Backstreets provide a surgery that fries pain receptors. Could this be similar?
→ As I repeatedly assert, Abnormalities are entities of their own category. You shouldn't construe them with the City's standards, Ishmael.
→ And yet Abnormalities physically exist in this realm. If the properties of a thing aren't determined by the laws of the space it exists in, can it truly be said to exist?
→ The hell are you yapping on about?
→ I don't believe it's necessary for you to understand, Heathcliff.
→ Huh? Is my name written here somewhere? How'd you know it was me?
→ …Funny. [A cigarette burn is left on the paper.]

I think I have an idea now.
When I approached the fainted tin men, I heard mechanical noises. It sounded like things were being fixed within.
If I had to guess… They seem to be equipped with devices that automatically repair their bodies.
But, the device didn't seem capable of carrying out more than five repairs.
Only trouble is that they grow stronger each time they're fixed up…
We should find a way to deal with them and stop this repair mechanism from getting to work. Until then, we'll have to bear with their five lives…
Oh, by the way:
How do you think the 'human' parts inside are being repaired?
→ Do not question the physics of Abnormalities.

Hmm... Writing is rather tedious work.
Oh, but I do suppose it's not a bad idea to write down my experiences. I hated when my grandfather scolded and pestered me into keeping a diary, but now, I'm not so averse to the thought.
So, I have to describe the appearance of that Abnormality, right?
Firstly... Its eyes were out of focus. It was drooling from the mouth, too.
Something about the color of the eyes and the saliva was off as well. They were all pink, same as the ribbon wrapped around the body.
Oh, speaking of ribbons, doesn't it bear a striking resemblance to silk?
I think our family kept a similar color of fabric. Though it wasn't the most luxurious... Hm, I do guess it's valuable in its own right.
Right, that's it! We used something like this for decoration on our younger sibling's birthday!

Oh dear, it looks like these used to be employees of this company.
Faust said that their outfits and employee IDs belonged to the former L Corp.
Goodness, I can't possibly imagine looting a corpse myself.
If it came down to me, I would've ordered a servant to handle the task. And I would have looked away from that gross sight and told the servant to explain it with words.
Oh... I wouldn't have taken interest in dead bodies in the first place, now that I think about it.
Could these deceased people be animated by those ribbons, perhaps?
The ribbons that grab us as we fight them...
If they wrap around us when we die, do you think we'll become like them?

dataList.name: You Want To Get Beat? Hurtily?

storyList.story:
-Composed of machinery, tin, plastic, steel, and circuits.
-Red or pink ribbons are coiled around the body.
-A pair of pink shoes are worn around the parts thought to be feet.
-The feet appear to have been forcibly shoved into the pink shoes.
-Anomalies observed in the color and direction of pupils in all entities.
-Will note new discoveries in a future report.
→ Damn, that's awful dry.

-Observed the pink ribbons encroach on us in prolonged combat.
-Sinners covered with a large quantity of ribbons were subject to heavily damaging attacks.
-Notable discovery: casualty from the attack caused the entities wearing pink ribbons to reanimate.
-The reanimation is thought to occur after a certain number of casualties.
-I request that the manager analyze the incidence and determine the tactical approach.
-Will note new discoveries in a future report.

-There is little doubt that this tin entity and those covered in ribbons shared the same state.
-Peer suggested that the ribbons be removed before it poses serious danger.
-I came in direct content with the ribbon while attempting the suggested solution.
-The ribbon did not have the texture of cloth or any other kind of fabric.
-Some resembled withered leaves, while others gave the tactile impression of a strong plant stem.
-One unambiguous conclusion is that the ribbons are alive.
-The ribbon's reaction to removal appeared to depend on the method of handling.
-Removal with force seemed to make the ribbon crumble more easily.
-No further discoveries to be made; the observation log is concluded.
→ I got into a panic and ripped them haphazardly, but it wasn't actually that tricky.
→ I was careful about it, worried that it might go wrong… But then the ribbon expanded all of a sudden and wrapped Hong Lu. Because of me, he…
→ I'm all okay, Sinclair~ It was a unique and fun experience!

I was ordered to describe facts about this in detail.
So I observed.
Placed on a wooden pedestal that seemed as though it was woven from fibers of muscles was a large stone plate.
As I approached it, its compartments of bricks began to rattle.
Seized by curiosity, I attempted to step closer for a better look...
Alas, my colleagues strongly discouraged me from doing so, so I turned away.
One thing I can say with confidence is that it was likely a tool for predicting a date of some kind, judging from the many letters carved on the bricks.
Such is all I have to say.
→ Those letters are from an ancient language. If Yi Sang's depiction is correct, that plate is almost certainly a calendar.

I had an opportunity to engage it in combat.
Though it may have been less than pleasant as an observer to see the object of study sustain damage, more discoveries could be had in the behaviors it displayed during battle.
It summoned a number of flesh dolls wearing stone masks made of what I believe is the same mineral as the plate.
By 'offering' these dolls to the plate, I was able to observe a change in its shape.
The rattling bricks gradually widened, and I could see red muscle fibers and strange spatial extensions...or such.
I can't say for sure how drastic the change will be, but an observable trend is that it's becoming more and more ominous.
Such is all I have to say.
→ Why the hell did you put me in instead of those masked blokes? You damned clockhead, I'll #%^&@[The rest is neatly censored with a correction tape.]
→ Dante made the right choice. From what I can see, it seems that those flesh dolls, or "clay dolls," can't be offered up while they're alive. The only other option we have is to sacrifice Sinners.
→ And why does that have to be me @(##$[The rest is neatly censored with a correction tape.]

I had an opportunity to be offered to this.
I am about to describe the disconcerting, wet, and abnormal experience here.
I took unwavering steps forward as the choice was reasonable. I had no reason to fear, for I would be brought back to life even if I were to perish.
I did not feel the death, so to speak. Though I have experienced death many times in battle, I was not subjected to the sort of pain or flashing disarray that normally accompanies a demise that time. It simply felt as though I was being transported to a different location.
It may be the universe or some other dimension.
My own body and voice couldn't be perceived by my senses. Perhaps my eyes had gone and I became part of that place.
There, I may have seen the end. You could say it was a doomsday I witnessed.
No perhaps I may have been the end and the doomsday I was present at the end but not existent and while it may be misleading to say that it was there but even still I witnessed man and sky and earth tear into thousands of pieces
[The rest is neatly censored with a correction tape.]
→ I had Yi Sang talk with the recovery staff from After Team for a moment. His psychological corruption seems rather severe. Dante, I think we should refrain from making our observers directly experience these events from now on.

Concluding the report.
I will report findings from a direct confrontation next time.

I encountered the entity in battle.
<Company Rules> Article 11, Paragraph 3 states I am to designate its risk level as TETH.
I will describe its behavior during combat.
The entities appear to use their thin yet elastic body for quick attacks.
They often charged into Sinners and grabbed their target tight. They were difficult to remove, and a few lives were lost due to their persistence.
As stated in the previous report, the entity appears to be closely related to the stone plate Abnormality. When the entities were killed and 'offered' to the stone plate Abnormality, a change in the plate's shape could be observed.
In addition, the masks of these entities gradually changed accordingly.
Faust is curious. I should make it my next task to study the extent of this transformation.
Concluding the report.
→ Um, hello, aren't you forgetting to mention the part where they hug us and belch fire? One of them burnt all my hair.
→ Hey Faust! Can't we sell these heads to an antique shop? Don't they look pretty pricey?

I observed the full extent of its changes.
Its mask had two forms it could assume.
While not as impressive as the four states the stone plate Abnormality could take, there was an undeniable connection between them.
It seems to be able to generate fire from within the mask. An autopsy after battle revealed no combustible materials stored inside, suggesting that the fire was not created via physical means.
No further discoveries were made.
...A shame, Faust was hoping to learn more things.
→ You made me stand guard for hours while you dissected their bodies, try to be happy with what you got.

I really don't feel like writing logs...
But I will...if I have to.
I haven't fought Kromer before or seen how N Corp's troops fight... But from what I could tell, she probably knows how to use a sword. She always carried one with her.
As for her looks... Not too different from what I remember, except a little taller...
And, that disorienting laughter...
Unnh, can I stop here?
→ None of this helps.

That bastard, she's killing our Sinners!
She murdered everyone in the back lines...
Blowing that stupid whistle... She came to me, too...
I couldn't do anything... Hearing that sound makes me go all stiff...
I could only watch as Kromer slew the others...
I wanted to crush her skull so dearly... But I couldn't move a muscle.
What should I do... Can you tell me, manager?

I'm...
I'm, still scared of Kromer.
Looking at her face makes my face twitch, and her blade gives me the chills.
Her maniacal eyes remind me of the tragedy on Christmas, and her creepy grin still has my eyes quivering.
But...
But I'm okay now.
I can stand up to her whistles now.
The things she's done are too vile for me to stand by, and I'd be too ashamed to see the Sinners she's killed if I let that bitch go.
I've changed a lot since then.
I've died a lot of deaths, and claimed a lot of lives.
I can go mad all the same now.
So, I will for sure…
I'll skewer her chest with a stake, over and over again.
→ You've got a good mindset. I like that.
→ While the willingness to fight is admirable, this log is for observations rather than decrees of your determination.
→ Sorry… I'll do it right next time.

When I think about it, Kromer always had an obsession with flesh.
And that obsession cumulated into what we're seeing now... A gruesome creature.
At first... I agreed with her. The idea of replacing the flesh with something else was unpleasant to me.
But now I see. What's really unpleasant...is believing that your thought is the only correct one...and letting that thought consume your mind whole.

It has the appearance of a fish.
-Its head has been cut off.
-The cut surface is clean; it appears to have been done with a single-sided edge, such as a knife or a scythe.
-It exhibits motion in spite of the lack of a head. I am aware that whether or not an Abnormality has an intact head is completely irrelevant to its ability to show activity, but I will note this regardless.
-An inflated sack visible around the chest area. Could not make clear observation.
-Will note new discoveries in a future report.

A silhouette is observed inside the inflated sack around the chest.
-It bears resemblance to a flower, or the central nervous system of a human.
-It expands the sack to use as blunt instrument, and can squeeze it at high speed to expel liquid.
-Overall, the sack is deemed to be a major component of its attacks; quick destruction should prove effective.
-Will note new discoveries in a future report.

I will describe my impressions of the encounter with this.
It has the appearance of three dark-furred wolves stitched together in a delicate operation. No, there may have been more, as it possessed more than three mouths.
Atop the canine heads was the figure of a person, charred beyond recognition. Though a combustion of that degree normally would have reduced such a figure to ashes, its form was as solid as it could be, its muscles even showing motion.
In addition, a heap of wooden telephone poles are lodged into the wolves' body as stakes would a prisoner. They seem to periodically emit electricity, but I couldn't fathom through what means they were able to do so.
Such is all I have to say.

I had an opportunity to engage it in combat.
It ran at me, galloping in a possessed motion.
Its visage was a far cry from a hound commanded to battle or a beast yearning to feed itself.
Running at me may have been its only choice.
I saw a purple arc of electricity sprint across its back. Which reminded me of animals tested under similar conditions in the laboratory.
Using electric stimuli, those animals were made to move as some other being intended.
It made me wonder if the same is happening to this creature.
While its claws hurt me gravely, I felt an ounce of pity for it as well.
Such is all I have to say.

It had a thunderous roar.
To describe it in more detail, it gathered bolts of lightning as if all the storms and thunders in the world struck it at once, so it wouldn't be an exaggeration to say that its roar has a thunderous property.
Naturally, I was able to identify the source of its electricity.
This creature was like a living battery. Collecting lightning in its body, it used the power to fuel itself.
Alas, its usage of the lightning's energy was not for a self-motivated purpose such as pursuit of strength;
the accumulated electric forces appeared to dictate its motion, giving me the impression that it was the will of the sky that it followed.
While drawing up such thoughts, Miss Faust reminded me that it's not right to have such impressions of Abnormalities.
Thus, I conclude the log here lest it becomes too sentimental.

Bleh, you've gotta be kidding... Why do I have to observe this thing and write a log about it?
I hate this kinda stuff~ Reptiles, bugs, and all that kind of critters... I can't stand 'em.
Not you though, Greg, sweetie~
Anyway, we still gotta fight this thing and all, so I did my share of looking.
Umm... First off, there's a whole lotta snakes.
It's got these huge serpents instead of arms, and... Bwegh, they kept flicking their tongues. Are those the "fingers"?
And that's not all. Smaller snakes were poking their heads out of the armor, too.
Isn't the whole suit filled with snakes?
Yipes, I wanna unsee that mental image!

This can't be real, it's gotta be some kinda joke!!
Can you believe it? That serpent for an arm grabbed me!
Pah... I just can't cool down.
That arm... I mean, the huge snake stretched all of a sudden and coiled around me.
When that cold and slimy thing touched me...
I didn't even care that I was about to die, I was so grossed out to even think that!
I was gasping for breath, strangled by those things, and then...
Blegh, all the small snakes hanging from the body started rushing at me!
All those bites and stings and tears... Ugh, what a mess that was.
I don't remember when I died or when I got back...
But I'm never getting that image outta my head for the rest of my life...
Dante, darling, could you please let me stay behind next time we fight these~?
→ While I'm sure I don't need to remind you, Dante, you should be selective about approving requests from Sinners.
→ Are you underestimating our Executive Manager? If they ask that you reposition yourself, you will do so, front or back. Do you understand?

Those snakes... They won't even die.
I could've sworn I finished it, but it was still standing, flicking its tongue.
Is it some kinda last stand or what... Like, don't you have to be alive to show endurance like that?
How do dead things even stand their ground and fight to their "last"?
They creep me out so much, I can't even. Maybe they'd be tolerable if they weren't snakes!

Not fond of writing, but I can't disobey orders.
Just don't come complaining at me. I can't write anything fancy pleasing to read.
First off... Those buggers look disgusting.
Weird clay-like things are all over their arms and legs... And they've got sodding eyes on 'em, too.
There's also a sharp blade thing―couldn't tell if it's a protrudding bone or a dried slab of that clay.
I guess that's what it uses to prod around, eh?
Oh, right. We've got a bug guy on our side, don't we? Looks kinda like his arm.
Maybe he's got more to tell you.
→ …I don't know where to start. I don't necessarily love my arm, but don't you think comparing it to that clay monster is going too far?
→ Got a problem, say it to my face.
→ Heathcliff. Please refrain from causing trouble. Also, profanities have no place in observation logs.
→ You're forcing me to write all this rubbish, and I can't even write however I like? Get someone else, then.

The white-haired lass keeps bugging me, but I'm writing this my way. These buggers spat on me mood enough in the fight today.
Those goggling eyeballs... Right, those things weren't actually clay.
Muscles... That's got to be it, muscles. Ripping one of those gave me the same feeling as tearing up an unlucky sod.
Seemed like those bundles of muscles sticking to the limbs were what's moving the body, acting like the whole thing belongs to 'em. The eyes on the face never flinched, only the ones on the arms.
Made it a bit tricky to fight 'em. I'm supposed to guess where it'll go next based on where it's looking, but that eye thing kept throwing me off. Well, I don't mind taking a hit too much if I can skelp 'em three times in return.
Another thing… Those things looked like they had feelings. Their muscles quivered each time I hit 'em. Squinted their eyes, too… Like it was getting mad.
Some clatty fruitcake they are.
→ What does a C.F. taste like? Is it artistic? You piqued my interest.
→ That's just a common Backstreets phrase… Meaning something absurd.
→ I know. J.K.

Normally, things like these grow back right as we break 'em, but those muscle lumps don't seem too good at that.
I doggedly bashed the big chunk o' muscles stuck to an arm, and I managed to crush it fine.
That didn't stop it from trying and hitting me, though… It didn't threaten me as much, but that didn't mean not much at all.
Right, I think it no longer did the thing where it gets right fuming and grabs one o' us to tear 'em off.
Yeah, it only makes sense, can't do the stabbing if that big knife's broken.

It wasn't the most pleasant encounter.
You might say that this would apply to facing any Abnormality in battle, but this one just...felt unusual, somehow.
It was sitting languidly still and crying strange noises, looking like it had given up on everything.
The protruding blue eyeballs were shifting around with no confidence...
Yeah. It was kinda getting on my nerves. I thought I might go crazy if I had to hear its cry any longer.
I would rather just...
→ Is that the reason you swung your mace against the orders? I find it hardly convincing.
→ Nah, I'm with her. I'd snap too if I kept listening to that bloody croak. 'Sides, we're supposed to beat those Abnormalities or whatever until they're eggs, aye? What's the problem here?
→ I, I thought so, too… I agreed it would've been better off to reduce it to an egg quickly…
→ What's clockface on about now. They're ticking an awful lot.
→ …Executive Manager asks for some respect for salvaging you tools after you gotyourselves killed in an idiotic charge.

I think I've learned one thing.
I don't know how it came to attack its foes with its own eyeballs, but it looks like getting hit by it drains your energy (on top of it being incredibly gross).
…Does it? Gimme a moment.
Hmm… I asked a few other Sinners about this.
In conclusion… The more times you're hit by its tongue, the deadlier the eyeball seesm to be.
I couldn't figure out further details, but I think it's safe to plan our tactics around avoiding its tongue, manager.
Which is good. It did not feel good to get hit.
→ Talk about a weirdo. It's not really tough at all, but it makes me feel all weak and drowsy~
→ Really? I, I felt a little different… Doesn't it make you more gloomy than anything?
→ Huh? How?
→ Like… Past memories popping up, or… Wanting to give up and die…
→ …Um, Faustie? Looks like our kiddie needs some mental aid?

The left eye reduces health, and the right eye damages sanity.
So that's how they worked.
Well... Not like this changes the fact that it's best to avoid both.
In any case, we now know why dragging on doesn't do us any favor.
I felt like I was being dragged deeper into the swamp of gloom as the fight went on.
I suggest we make quick work of it with fast and powerful attacks, manager.
P.S. This just occurred to me...
I wonder what would've happened we just waiting until it's finished crying?
No, I'm not saying we should try it. I don't see it being efficient, either.
It's just... I remember someone doing the same for me a long time ago, and it helped me back then.

I dunno a lot about robots or machines like this...
Wait, have I...? I might have seen this one before. It was standing still in a room back then.
Right~ That souvenir robot!
Yeah, it had a panel on its chest where you could write stuff.
This thing looks like it'll chop you in half if you dared touch its chest, though...
Come to think of it, I remember running away from the robot because it tried to take away the thing it gave me. Robot arms came out clanking just like now, too.
Reflecting on it, back in my day…
Hah, guess it goes further back, actually. People much older than me used to work with hunks of metal like that, or so I heard.
If the stories are to be believed, some were modified for combat purposes. That sure takes me back…
→ Old fart.
→ …Who wrote this?

Damn, I didn't expect this of all things to get me nostalgic.
In the Backstreets, you could sometimes find toys from ages ago.
One of them was a toy crane where you grab dolls trapped behind the glass. You move the claw using a joystick from the outside, and send it down to grab whatever's underneath.
It was pretty tight. Yep.
And here I am... Being put in the dolls' shoes after all this time.
I sure as hell didn't see this stupid machine play the crane game with us!
And when it catches something, it saws the prize along the neck…
Ugh, talk about ruined childhood memories.

Alright, I think I figured it out.
This is pretty disturbing, but... When it tried to grab us, we managed to dodge it one time.
After that big robot claw went upwards… Bah, sorry, I thought I got over it.
It came down again, holding some…machine egg thing.
When I got closer… I saw that the mechanical film was pounding to a beat.
Like a heart.
I know, this makes no sense normally. So don't comment stuff like "a heart can't beat outside an organism's systems" or whatever. You saw that thing move too, right?
.
.
.
I have to write what we did about it in full detail, huh…
I mean, what more do I say, really. We chopped that thing off.
The claw was a pretty big bother to get around, but when we cut into that thing somehow, that tin can stopped moving! Haha, that sure gave us a breather.
…Well, it might be because the heart belonged to the robot.
It's creepy, but whatever. It's an Abnormality, yeah?
I didn't get to spare much sympathy for others during the war, and I'm definitely not wasting any on unknown freaks like that.
We've got to live.

Recording the information gained from an encounter with the entity.
This entity was first identified by the Preliminary Observation of LCC Before Team, and it was to be captured by After Team's Special Ops department.
However, it appears that we encountered it through the mirror before they could perform the task.
With the above-mentioned facts in consideration, I will describe the information gathered from Before Team's observation and our encounter with it in a comprehensive manner.
-The Abnormality is speculated to be a statue created as an idol for worship.
-The Abnormality appears to be floating in the air at all times, and shows no particular movement outside of gesturing with one hand.
-Is ■■■■ with a related Abnormality ■■■■■■; may suggest a connection of some kind, though details are unclear. [Authorization from a higher security level is required to access the data.]
-Similar to how it floats, it attacks by "levitating" objects and sending them flying.
Concluding the report.
→ Those cleaners found it first? I thought it was their job to catch 'em and put 'em away?
→ As explained before, we stand between multiple different possibilities via refractions. After Team may have been late in this possibility, or even nonexistent.
→ (A writing seems to have been scribbled out with a pen.) Alright, I got that loud and clear.
→ Someone is unconvincing.

Recording the information gained from encountering the entity in battle.
I will describe its behavior during combat.
It was always accompanied by a group of followers. Observation suggested that they were under the influence of a type of mind control. The lack of any common factors shared by all followers in terms of attire or other external features added further plausibility to the speculation.
It appears to attack using a khakkhara holding spiritual significance.The staff floated in a similar manner to the Abnormality. It looks as though the staff has its own sentience.
Also, due to an unidentified interference...most attacks proved ineffective.
Attacks to the core will not achieve much until the cause is found.
I will note progress made in a future report.
Concluding the report.
→ Wait, wait. You forgot that weird ring.
→ It…gives a strange feeling. I don't know why it comes to us, but when it sticks to the back, it feels...strange. Like a pressure is weighing down on the mind…
→ You had the time to feel all that? As for me, the hit I took while the ring was attached to me cut me in half by the waist. I can almost still feel it even now.
→ Really…? I, I don't think I got hurt that bad.
→ Hm. That does remind me of the occasion when the airborne ring returned to me at one moment. It may be the case that there is a rule behind its movement.

Recording the reason for the unsuccessful attacks.
Its followers appear to be directly linked to the Abnormality.
The Abnormality will most likely not suffer meaningful damage until all followers have been defeated.
There seems to have been a kind of contractual obligation that requires the followers to protect the Abnormality.
There is another discovery to report.
After its body has been broken and the head has fallen, it started attacking its own followers at random.
Although breaking the body was an arduous task, it proved to be quite effective for its suppression.
Concluding the report.
→ It almost looked angry, the way it moved. I guess… It was lashing out at its minions for failing to protect it?
→ To think it would punish its soldiers on the front lines for errors in the operation. It's hardly surprising that a floating statue makes an incompetent commander.

-An inflated sack visible around the chest area. Could not make clear observation.
-Will note new discoveries in a future report.

There are far more appalling and fearsome things out there, but I need to make this clear:
That looks horrifying.
It may look like a wild animal from a distance, but as you get closer, the curiosity turns into disgust, like the feeling you get from beings roaming around the Outskirts.
Bundles of muscle fibers protruded from its skin, covering its body like a coat of fur. And its ribs seem to have flipped upside down and ripped through the back.
Its arms―or should I say legs―definitely had the appearance of human limbs, but their movement wasn't.
That's right; it was a beast.
→ Dost thou speak the truth when you say creatures like that inhabit the Outskirts?!
→ No, you won't find things like that.
→ Well, I never… Then for what reason didst thou use such a description?
→ There were worse things.

Those things are too quick. Their reaction speed is clearly above average human level.
They've got wits, too. Rather than jumping in recklessly...
They use the tactic of striking at the weakest target in the back lines before quickly running away.
It happened in our last encounter with them, too; when you ordered a badly injured Sinner to fall back, those things jumped at them to scratch open an atery and ran off like the wind as if they understood what your command meant.
I'm not sure how they reacted like that to some ticking noises... Oh, I guess it's possible that the Distorted hear it differently.

Even if they charge at us in large numbers, we should stay level-headed.
A Sinner or two might die in the process, but... It's a necessary sacrifice. At least we can revive.
I remember you going through a lot of trouble last time when you tried dealing with all of them at the same time and got us all killed. It's as if they grow stronger the more they're attacked.
Ah, speaking of my death...
It brings me back to the moment when those things chewed up my intestines.
I think I died before I could feel the pain, but somehow... I felt as though I was falling into an endless pit of fire.
It wasn't hot or searing, just...
Being with the fire felt oddly natural.
I guess it's a good thing I was brought back before I experienced more of that. My thanks go to the manager.
